docs.snippet: COMMON COUNCIL,--A regular meeting of the Board of Aldermen was held last evening, A communication was presented by Alderman VAN BAUNT, containing allegations of fraud on the part of Alderman DAYTON, of the Eleventh Ward, in giving out the...
docs.lead_paragraph: COMMON COUNCIL,--A regular meeting of the Board of Aldermen was held last evening, A communication was presented by Alderman VAN BAUNT, containing allegations of fraud on the part of Alderman DAYTON, of the Eleventh Ward, in giving out the street-cleaning contract.

docs.snippet: The Washington correspondent of the Philadelphia North American says of the President: "The approaching Presidential visit to Chapel ??., North Carolina, is intended to be preparatory to the Charleston Convention. Mr. Buchanan causes it to be...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Washington correspondent of the Philadelphia North American says of the President: "The approaching Presidential visit to Chapel ??., North Carolina, is intended to be preparatory to the Charleston Convention. Mr. Buchanan causes it to be announced every few days that his health was never mode rugged and his appetite never more ravenous.

docs.snippet: HEALTH COMMISSIONERS.--The Commissioners of Health met in the Mayors' office, Mayor TIEMANN, Councilman CORNELL, Drs. ROCKWELL, GUNN, MILLER and BOYD, the HEALTH Officer of Brooklyn were present. Messrs. HURIBY, STUART and others, residents in the...
docs.lead_paragraph: HEALTH COMMISSIONERS.--The Commissioners of Health met in the Mayors' office, Mayor TIEMANN, Councilman CORNELL, Drs. ROCKWELL, GUNN, MILLER and BOYD, the HEALTH Officer of Brooklyn were present. Messrs. HURIBY, STUART and others, residents in the neighborhood of Fiftieth and Fifty seventh streets, between Broadway and Seventh-avenue, complained of sundry pig-pens and bone-boiling establishments in that part of City.

docs.snippet: The rumor that agents of several foreign Govern mints are in this country purchasing arms is not credited here, as none of the foreign Ministers have received notice of such agencies or orders. The State Department anticipates receiving treaty from...

headline.main: NEWS BY TELEGRAPH.; FROM WASHINGTON. The Rumored Purchase of Arms by Foreign Governments--Expected Treaty with Mexico--Maltreatment of American Citizens, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The rumor that agents of several foreign Govern mints are in this country purchasing arms is not credited here, as none of the foreign Ministers have received notice of such agencies or orders. The State Department anticipates receiving treaty from Mexico in the course of a month, as Mr. McLANE was instructed to proceed on the basis proposed by the Juarez Government and conclude a Convention.

docs.snippet: Board of Aldermen. ANOTHER NOMINATION FOR CITY INSPECTOR--THE ERMISSION OF TAXES BY THE COMMON COUNCIL--APPROPRIATIONS. The Mayor, last evening, nominated to the Board of Aldermen Daniel E. Delavan for City Inspector.
docs.lead_paragraph: Board of Aldermen. ANOTHER NOMINATION FOR CITY INSPECTOR--THE ERMISSION OF TAXES BY THE COMMON COUNCIL--APPROPRIATIONS. The Mayor, last evening, nominated to the Board of Aldermen Daniel E. Delavan for City Inspector.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New- York Times: In certain quarters there is a good deal of disappointment at the failure of the new Health bill at Albany. docs.snippet: The widow of the famous Republican General Hoche died a fortnight since, in Paris, at a very advanced age. Hoche was the General who made a descent on the south of Ireland at the time of the first revolution. He torashed the Austrians at Wissembourg,...
docs.lead_paragraph: The widow of the famous Republican General Hoche died a fortnight since, in Paris, at a very advanced age. Hoche was the General who made a descent on the south of Ireland at the time of the first revolution. He torashed the Austrians at Wissembourg, 2nd for his defeat of two of the principal armies of the Chouans received the title of Pacificsteur de la Vendec.

docs.snippet: The business season of this, "the lesser of the Spanish Artilles," is now well nigh over. The following are the only American vessels in port at the moment of writing. Brig Julia, of Boston, (new Captain appointed.) will sail for New-York in a few...
docs.lead_paragraph: The business season of this, "the lesser of the Spanish Artilles," is now well nigh over. The following are the only American vessels in port at the moment of writing. Brig Julia, of Boston, (new Captain appointed.) will sail for New-York in a few days; brig R. R. Kirkland, for Baltimore on the 4th, loaded with sugar and molasses; brig Vinloo, loading for New-York:

docs.snippet: The screw-steamship New-York. Captain VONSAFTEN, from Southampton May 17, arrived here yesterday, bringing three days' later intelligence from Europe. The Saxonia arrived at Southampton May 15. The Jura arrived at Liverpool on the 16th inst.

headline.main: THREE DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE.; Arrival of the Screw-Steamship New-York. Movements of the Combatants in Italy. Napoleon III at the Head of the Allied Army. NO GENERAL ACTION. WARLIKE ATTITUDE OF PRUSSIA. PROSPECT OF A GENERAL WAR. The Queen of England Reviewing her Armies. THE EFFECT OF WAR UPON TRADE. Organization of the Tuscan Government. Cotton Declining, Breadstuffs Advanced. CONSOLS 91 5-8 @ 91 7-8 FOR MONEY

docs.lead_paragraph: The screw-steamship New-York. Captain VONSAFTEN, from Southampton May 17, arrived here yesterday, bringing three days' later intelligence from Europe. The Saxonia arrived at Southampton May 15. The Jura arrived at Liverpool on the 16th inst.

docs.snippet: RIDGEWOOD WATER-THE RATES-More than 4 000 families are now using the Ridgewood water, and every plumber in the city is so busy that but few can fill an order for water in less than th ee weeks after receiving notice of the applicant. The new engine...
docs.lead_paragraph: RIDGEWOOD WATER-THE RATES-More than 4 000 families are now using the Ridgewood water, and every plumber in the city is so busy that but few can fill an order for water in less than th ee weeks after receiving notice of the applicant. The new engine at East New-York throwing water into the main Reservoir, now works satisfactorily.
